An act or instance of multiplying.

definitions.definition: To grow in number.
To breed or propagate.
To perform multiplication.

To activate again.

definitions.definition: A young upwardly mobile urban professional person with an affluent lifestyle.
To affect (someone) strongly and often favourably.

definitions.definition: To make an impression, to be impressive.
definitions.example: Henderson impressed in his first game as captain.

definitions.definition: To produce a vivid impression of (something).
definitions.example: That first view of the Eiger impressed itself on my mind.

definitions.definition: To mark or stamp (something) using pressure.
definitions.example: We impressed our footprints in the wet cement.

definitions.definition: To produce (a mark, stamp, image, etc.); to imprint (a mark or figure upon something).
To fix deeply in the mind; to present forcibly to the attention, etc.; to imprint; to inculcate.

definitions.definition: To seize or confiscate (property) by force.

To rotate rapidly.
To twist round.
The motion of something that twirls.

The act of redeploying.
A new deployment.
Of an item that is one of a pair, the other item in the pair.
Of a regular polyhedron with V vertices and F faces, the regular polyhedron having F vertices and V faces.

definitions.definition: (grammar) dual number The grammatical number of a noun marking two of something (as in singular, dual, plural), sometimes referring to two of anything (a couple of, exactly two of), or a chirality-marked pair (as in left and right, as with gloves or shoes) or in some languages as a discourse marker, "between you and me". A few languages display trial number.
Of a vector in an inner product space, the linear functional corresponding to taking the inner product with that vector. The set of all duals is a vector space called the dual space.
(of animals or plants) To cause to continue or multiply by generation, or successive production
To cause to spread to extend; to impel or continue forward in space

To multiply; to increase.
To generate; to produce.
To produce young; to be produced or multiplied by generation, or by new shoots or plants
To take effect on all relevant devices in a network.

definitions.definition: To cause to take effect on all relevant devices in a network.
definitions.example: The server propagates the password file at midnight each day.

definitions.definition: A person with deviant behaviour; a deviant, degenerate or pervert.
A value equal to the difference between a measured variable factor and a fixed or algorithmic reference value.
To go off course from; to change course; to change plans.
To fall outside of, or part from, some norm; to stray.

definitions.definition: To ask about (something).
A teacher of Hindu mysticism

A heavy subatomic particle created by the binding of quarks by gluons; a hadron containing three quarks. Baryons have half-odd integral spin and are thus fermions. This category includes the common proton and neutron of the atomic nucleus.
A heavy garment worn over other clothes, for protection from cold or weather.
To apply an exterior coating to.
A union or alliance of states or political organizations.
The act of forming an alliance.

A common measure of sound intensity ratio that is one tenth of a bel on the logarithmic intensity scale. It is defined as dB = 10 log10(P1 / P2), where P1 and P2 are the relative powers of the sound.

A unit of measurement of land in the Netherlands and the Dutch colonies and parts of the United States, where it was equivalent to about two acres; and in Denmark, Norway, and Germany, where it was equivalent to about two-thirds of an acre. Now used informally in Germany to mean one quarter of a hectare.
A stroke made across the chest from the off-hand side to the racquet hand side; a stroke during which the back of the hand faces the shot.
Handwriting that leans to the left
(Ultimate Frisbee) the standard throw; a throw during which the disc begins on the off-hand side and travels across the chest to be released from the opposite side.
The reverse side of the human hand.
The hand towards the back of the board.
To execute a backhand stroke or throw
To slap with the back of one's hand
(handwriting) Of any left slanting handwriting
(of strokes or throws) In the backhand style
Of a play that uses the back side of the hockey stick
definitions.example: He scored on a backhand shot.

definitions.definition: One who, or that which, activates.
Something that activates a catalyst
Any chemical or agent which regulates one or more genes by increasing the rate of transcription.
A type of effector that increases the rate of enzyme-mediated reactions.
A type of dopant used in phosphors and scintillators.
An agent that enables the flotation of a mineral or minerals.
A room-like, roofed projection from a sloping roof
Dormer-window
A resident of a dormitory
A slackening or arrest of the blood current, due not to a lessening of the heart’s beat, but to some abnormal resistance of the capillary walls.
Inactivity; a freezing, or state of motionlessness.
definitions.example: His company was sized for growth, not stasis.

definitions.definition: A technology allowing something to be artificially frozen in time, so that it does not age or change.
One of the sections of a cathisma or portion of the psalter.
A type of large constricting snake.
Penis
Large and well-developed muscles in the upper arm.
(in Venezuela or the Dominican Republic) A slum on the periphery of a major city; a low to middle-class neighborhood in a lesser city.
(in some Spanish-speaking countries) A municipality or subdivision of a municipality.
(in the Philippines) A barangay.
An area or neighborhood in a US city inhabited predominantly by Spanish-speakers or people of Hispanic origin.
A deprived person; deprived people (normally used as a plural).
Deprived of the opportunities and advantages of others, usually through no fault of one's own.
Overpowering fright, often affecting groups of people or animals.
Rapid reduction in asset prices due to broad efforts to raise cash in anticipation of continuing decline in asset prices.
A kernel panic or system crash.
To feel overwhelming fear.
To cause somebody to panic.
(by extension) To crash.
(by extension) To cause the system to crash.
A person involved in the ownership or management of an industrial enterprise.
One who performs or enjoys industrial music.
A metal link with a gate that can open and close, generally used for clipping ropes to anchors or other objects.
In a competent manner.
A miscellaneous collection of different things; a miscellany.
A miscellany.
An instance of admixing, a mixing in of something.
definitions.example: The admixture of vanilla extract in the dough improved the pastries' flavor.

definitions.definition: A mixture, in some contexts
The act of prolonging.
That which has been prolonged; an extension.
An act of tucking; a pleat or fold.
A fold in fabric that has been stitched in place from end to end, as to reduce the overall dimension of the fabric piece.
A curled position.
A plastic surgery technique to remove excess skin.
(piano, when playing scales on piano keys) The act of keeping the thumb in position while moving the rest of the hand over it to continue playing keys that are outside the thumb.
A curled position, with the shins held towards the body.
The afterpart of a ship, immediately under the stern or counter, where the ends of the bottom planks are collected and terminate by the tuck-rail.
A rapier, a sword.
The beat of a drum.
To pull or gather up (an item of fabric).
To push into a snug position; to place somewhere safe or somewhat hidden.
definitions.example: Tuck in your shirt.  I tucked in the sheet.  He tucked the $10 bill into his shirt pocket.

definitions.definition: (often with "in" or "into") To eat; to consume.
To fit neatly.
definitions.example: The sofa tucks nicely into that corner.  Kenwood House is tucked into a corner of Hampstead Heath.

definitions.definition: To curl into a ball; to fold up and hold one's legs.
definitions.example: The diver tucked, flipped, and opened up at the last moment.

definitions.definition: To sew folds; to make a tuck or tucks in.
definitions.example: to tuck a dress

definitions.definition: To full, as cloth.
(of a drag queen, trans woman, etc.) To conceal one’s penis and testicles, as with a gaff or by fastening them down with adhesive tape.
definitions.example: Honey, have you tucked today? We don’t wanna see anything nasty down there.

definitions.definition: (when playing scales on piano keys) To keep the thumb in position while moving the rest of the hand over it to continue playing keys that are outside the thumb.
Any of several plants, of the genus Arnica, considered to have medicinal properties, especially Arnica montana.
Care for elderly people.
To get on a boat or ship or (outside the USA) an aeroplane.
definitions.example: All passengers please embark now.

definitions.definition: To start, begin.
definitions.example: Phil embarked on his journey yesterday.

definitions.definition: To cause to go on board a vessel or boat; to put on shipboard.
To engage, enlist, or invest (as persons, money, etc.) in any affair.
definitions.example: He embarked his fortune in trade.

definitions.definition: To root up; to tear up by the roots, or as if by the roots; to extirpate.
(by extension) To remove from a familiar circumstance, especially suddenly and unwillingly.
To destroy utterly; to eradicate, exterminate.
(of a plant) Having been fully removed, including the roots.
(by extension) Having been removed from a familiar circumstance, especially suddenly and unwillingly.
Administered through placement under the tongue.
Situated beneath the tongue.
A sharp, hooked claw of a bird of prey or other predatory animal.
One of certain small prominences on the hind part of the face of an elephant's tooth.
A kind of moulding, concave at the bottom and convex at the top; an ogee. (When the concave part is at the top, it is called an inverted talon.)
The shoulder of the bolt of a lock on which the key acts to shoot the bolt.
In various card games, the remaining stock of undealt cards.
To bring something out of shape, to misshape.
To become misshapen.
To give a false or misleading account of
definitions.example: In their articles, journalists sometimes distort the truth.

definitions.definition: Duality; the condition of being double.
The view that the world consists of, or is explicable in terms of, two fundamental principles, such as mind and matter or good and evil.
The belief that the world is ruled by a pair of antagonistic forces, such as good and evil; the belief that man has two basic natures, the physical and the spiritual.

The theory, originated by Lavoisier and developed by Berzelius, that all definite compounds are binary in their nature, and consist of two distinct constituents, themselves simple or complex, and having opposite chemical or electrical affinities.
A symphony.
A piece or music serving as an overture, interlude or ritornello.
A small symphony orchestra.
Grandmother
A complicated or clandestine plot or scheme intended to effect some purpose by secret artifice; conspiracy; stratagem.
The plot of a play, poem or romance; the series of complications in which a writer involves their imaginary characters.
Clandestine intercourse between persons; illicit intimacy; a liaison or affair.
To conceive or carry out a secret plan intended to harm; to form a plot or scheme.
To arouse the interest of; to fascinate.
To have clandestine or illicit intercourse.
To fill with artifice and duplicity; to complicate.
An organism which eats others of its own species or kind, especially a human who eats human flesh.
A hormone that stimulates contractions during labor, and then the production of milk.
A type of fine powder, as of sandarac, or cuttlefish bone, sprinkled over wet ink to dry the ink after writing or on rough paper to smooth the writing surface.
Charcoal dust, or some other coloured powder for making patterns through perforated designs, used by embroiderers, lacemakers, etc.
A sudden leaping attack.
The claw or talon of a bird of prey.
A punch or stamp.
Cloth worked in eyelet holes.
To sprinkle or rub with pounce powder.
definitions.example: to pounce paper, or a pattern

definitions.definition: To leap into the air intending to seize someone or something.
definitions.example: She pounced on the young man, because she loved him and wanted him for herself.

definitions.definition: To attack suddenly by leaping.
definitions.example: I was awakened from a dead sleep by my child pouncing on top of me from out of nowhere.

definitions.definition: To eagerly seize an opportunity.
definitions.example: I pounced on the chance to get promoted.

definitions.definition: To strike or seize with the talons; to pierce, as with the talons.
To stamp holes in; to perforate.
A person who studies or practises genealogy, an expert in genealogy.
To assist (someone or something) by granting a subsidy.
A pear-shaped plucked lute from China.
A U-shaped piece of wood used as a collar for an ox, the upper parts fastened to its yoke
A meander in a river; the land enclosed by such a loop
The amount that will fit in a mouth.
definitions.example: He swallowed a mouthful of sea water when he fell in.

definitions.definition: Quite a bit.
Something difficult to pronounce or say.
definitions.example: “She sells sea shells” is a bit of a mouthful to say.

definitions.definition: A tirade of abusive language (especially in the term “give someone a mouthful”)
To cause a quality to become part of someone's nature.
definitions.example: It is important to instill discipline in a child at an early age.

definitions.definition: To pour in (medicine, for example) drop by drop.
A common measure of sound intensity ratio that is one tenth of a bel on the logarithmic intensity scale. It is defined as dB = 10 log10(P1 / P2), where P1 and P2 are the relative powers of the sound.
The outermost whorl of flower parts, comprising the sepals, which covers and protects the petals as they develop.
Any of various cup-like structures.
Value; worth.
Strength of mind in regard to danger; the quality which enables a person to encounter danger with firmness
A brave man; a man of valour.
In a mighty manner; with strength or force.
Thoroughly; entirely.
definitions.example: He sounded mightily proud of himself.

definitions.definition: To rebuild or replenish with all new material; to restore to original (or better) working order and appearance.
The act by which something is refurbished.
An inaccurate statement or statistic believed to be true because of broad repetition, especially if cited in the media.
(originally North America) An interesting item of trivia; a minor fact.
A modern American breed of domestic cat that relaxes completely when picked up.
A model consisting of a set of connected rigid bodies that can collapse in a loose, natural manner.
To be flung about, such that a person has an appearance like that of a rag doll that is flung about.
Lacking strength; weak.
Ungraceful in movement.
Difficult to carry, handle, manage or operate because of its size, weight, shape or complexity.
Badly managed or operated.
To make perpetual; to preserve from extinction or oblivion.
To prolong the existence of.
To convert from one encoding to another.
A conversion between encodings.
A senior secretary or official with administrative or legal duties, sometimes in charge of some area of government such as finance or justice.
definitions.example: Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster  Lord Chancellor

definitions.definition: The head of the government in some German-speaking countries.
definitions.example: the Austrian Chancellor

definitions.definition: A senior record keeper of a cathedral; a senior legal officer for a bishop or diocese in charge of hearing cases involving ecclesiastical law.
The head of a university, sometimes purely ceremonial.
Short for Chancellor of the Exchequer.
The foreman of a jury.
The chief judge of a court of chancery (that is, one exercising equity jurisdiction).
Someone weak and unimportant.
A geek or nerd, especially a computer user with a deficient social life.
(collectible card games) A small creature which has a low cost to put into play, often used in a swarm with other such creatures.
A wiener.
The penis.
To overstate, to describe more than is fact.
definitions.example: He said he'd slept with hundreds of girls, but I know he's exaggerating. The real number is about ten.

definitions.definition: To subject to a penalty, especially for the infringement of a rule or regulation.
To impose a handicap on.
To burn with no flame and little smoke.
To show signs of repressed anger or suppressed mental turmoil or other strong emotion, such as passion.
To exist in a suppressed or hidden state.
(sometimes figurative) The act by which something smoulders; residual heat.
definitions.example: the smoulderings of the Thirty Years War

definitions.definition: To renew the terms of a loan.
A program-length television commercial, typically between thirty minutes and one hour long, that advertises a product or service by presenting supposedly impartial information about it.
A deliberate affront or slight.
definitions.example: I hope the people we couldn't invite don't see it as a snub.

definitions.definition: A sudden checking of a cable or rope.
A knot; a protuberance; a snag.
To slight, ignore or behave coldly toward someone.
To turn down; to dismiss.
definitions.example: He snubbed my offer of help.

definitions.definition: To check; to reprimand.
To stub out (a cigarette etc).
To halt the movement of a rope etc by turning it about a cleat or bollard etc; to secure a vessel in this manner.
To clip or break off the end of; to check or stunt the growth of.
To sob with convulsions.
Conspicuously short.
definitions.example: a snub-nosed revolver

definitions.definition: Of the nose: flat and broad, with the end slightly turned up.
(of a polyhedron) Derived from a simpler polyhedron by the addition of extra triangular faces.
